title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to limit the Federal employee status of Commission members, allow acceptance of matching funds for projects, and address personnel matters within the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to address personnel matters by limiting the Federal employee status of Commission members and allowing acceptance of matching funds for approved projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to limit Federal employee status of Commission members and allow acceptance of matching funds for approved projects. Amendments include changes to compensation and personnel appointment regulations. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to appoint necessary personnel and terminate them as needed. The Economic Development Committee section is also amended to allow discretion in decision-making. The Denali Commission is granted special functions under Section 3. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program on careers related to infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program will focus on construction, operations, maintenance, and management of Commission projects, as well as initiatives to encourage Alaskan youths to support these projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes training programs for construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects, management training, initiatives for Alaskan youths to support projects, and public infrastructure projects. Amounts made available to the Commission remain available until expended. The Commission provides assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes training programs for construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects, management training, initiatives for Alaskan youths to support projects, and public infrastructure projects. The Commission provides assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including activities like housing development, acquisition, rehabilitation, new construction, and multisite rehabilitation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
